discourse_list.title: 28th September Executive: Updating the proxy_actions_end_cropper address

content.content: 28th September Executive: Updating the proxy_actions_end_cropper address The proposed Wednesday 28th September executive includes updating the chainlog address for the PROXY_ACTIONS_END_CROPPER.  New contract: 0x38f7C166B5B22906f04D8471E241151BA45d97Af This contract is verified on Etherscan and matches the code from commit c755fd62f876f0b25a93028392dc850c0dc49f6e for the DssProxyActionsCropper.sol  Details: As part of the system shutdown operation, DAI can be redeemed for collateral. This includes calling End.cash and GemJoin.exit. Such operations are grouped together in the dedicated end-proxy-actions permissionless contracts. With regards to collateral that use the Cropper contract, the sequence is more complicated and includes additional steps. One of these steps is passing claim rights to the redeemer, so it can get rewards from the 3rd party (aka tacking). This step was missing from the DssProxyActionsCropper contract and has now been added. This omission was detected as part of PECU emergency shutdown simulations.
content.GPT-summary: The post explains a proposed update to the chainlog address for the PROXY_ACTIONS_END_CROPPER contract, which is verified on Etherscan and matches the code from commit c755fd62f876f0b25a93028392dc850c0dc49f6e for the DssProxyActionsCropper.sol. The update includes adding a missing step in the sequence for collateral that uses the Cropper contract, which was detected during PECU emergency shutdown simulations. The post does not advertise the proposal, ask for feedback, or provide entirely positive or negative feedback.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
